intro: Lissochilus schweinfurthii, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand cold and strong winds. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
